intro: Mollinedia salicifolia, commonly known as the willow-leaf mallow, is a herbaceous plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features heart-shaped, willow-like leaves with a soft, downy texture. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
